Detailed Description

The incremental paint device context updater supports periodically updating a paint device context if the drawing process itself is a rather long task and therefore progress feedback should be given to the user. If the paint device context is the main display, this gets updated immediately. If the incremental updater works on a paint device context different from the main display then no visual feedback can be given directly. Therefore, in any case, messages are automatically sent indicating the progress or interruption of the drawing task. Anybody who is interested can listen and accordingly react to these messages, e.g. a progress bar can (additionally) visually indicate the progress of the drawing task.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

IncrementalPdcUpdater::IncrementalPdcUpdater (  const void *  client,
PaintDc &  pdc,
INT  max_delay = 500
) 
 

Creates and connects the updater to the given client and paint device context pdc. The desired maximal delay between two device context updates defaults to 500 but may be specified differently by optional parameter max_delay.

IncrementalPdcUpdater::~IncrementalPdcUpdater (   )  [virtual]
 

The destructor of a derived class has to call Finish().

Finish()

Member Function Documentation

INT IncrementalPdcUpdater::CalcProgress (  INT  total_steps,
INT  completed_steps
)  [static, protected]
 

Calculates the progress in percentage (1 to 100) from the given total_steps and completed_steps.

Parameters:
total_steps Number of steps to be done to completely process some task.
completed_steps Number of steps already processed.

void IncrementalPdcUpdater::Finish (   )  const
 

Finishes partial device context updates done by the incremental update handling mechanism. This method has to be called at the end of the incremental update handling mechanism. Any call to Init() has to be properly ended with a call to this method Finish(). If this is not done by the client then the destructor of the derived class has to take care of calling it. For this purpose the derived destructor has to call Finish(). If the updater is connected to the main display this is updated directly. In any case a progress message inidicating completion of updating (i.e. progress equals to 100) is sent.

See also:
Init

~IncrementalPdcUpdater

void IncrementalPdcUpdater::Init (   ) 
 

Initializes the incremental update handling mechanism. A timer which is later used by method TimeExpired() is started. In addition a progress message inidicating start of updating (i.e. progress equals to 0) is sent.

See also:
TimeExpired

virtual void IncrementalPdcUpdater::SendInterruptedMsg (   )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

Abstract method called to send an interrupted message. Any subclass has to implement it. The message sent might take into account the client m_client.

Implemented in ImageIncrementalPdcUpdater.

Abstract method called to send a progress message. Any subclass has to implement it. The message sent might take into account the client m_client.

Implemented in ImageIncrementalPdcUpdater.

BOOLEAN IncrementalPdcUpdater::TimeExpired (   )  const
 

Tells whether the time span for handling an incremental update has expired. If so, the client may prepare for an update and then process it by calling Update(). Method Init() has to be called before applying this method.

See also:
Init

Update

BOOLEAN IncrementalPdcUpdater::Update (  INT  total_steps,
INT  completed_steps
) 
 

Handles the update request. In case we are painting to the main display this gets updated directly. In any case a progress message taking into account the progress information given via parameters total_steps and completed_steps is sent. In case of drawing to the main display it is also checked if the user asked for stopping the task by pressing any key. In this case an interruption message is sent and FALSE is returned. The caller should react to it accordingly, e.g. freeing ressources and stopping the drawing process. E.g. a progress bar can react to the interruption message accordingly.

Parameters:
total_steps Number of steps to be done to completely process some task.
completed_steps Number of steps already processed.

BOOLEAN IncrementalPdcUpdater::UpdatesMainDisplay (   )  const
 

Tells if the updater updates the main display.
